title: Love it or hate it: Asda has just MIXED prosecco with wine - and it's a bargain
text:
Love it or hate it: Asda has just MIXED prosecco with wine - and it's a bargain Just days after figures warned the cost of prosecco is on the rise, Asda has come up with a new genius was to enjoy your favourite tipple - without forking out a penny extra Share Comments By Emma Munbodh 16:47, 16 FEB 2017 Updated 16:48, 16 FEB 2017 Money A new 'pro' wine is set to take the supermarket aisles by storm (Photo: Asda Good Living) If you're stuck in a constant battle between prosecco and white wine - your prayers may have just been answered.
Supermarket giant Asda has today launched its latest offering - 'Progrigio' - which promises to be a delightful mix of prosecco and the nation's favourite white wine - pinot grigio.
The Italian drink - which is made by blending prosecco glera grape with pinot grigio - is sourced from the Mediterranean and costs just £5. It launches in stores nationwide from Thursday.
The invention arrives just days after the UK’s Wine and Spirit Trade Association warned of a dramatic price hike in the wake of Brexit on the number one tipple.
It said prosecco prices could rise by 9% - or an average of 59p per bottle in the coming months, due to growing demand and rising costs from suppliers.
Read More From prosecco to Peugeots: The huge price rises we’ve already seen, and the big rises still on the way
The sparkling wine sector is currently worth over £604.4 million in the UK - and Asda has seen sales rise by 33% over the past two years.
Asda says customers won't be disappointed (Photo: Getty)
Asda's wine buyer Jack Clayton said: "Progrigio is a new Italian sparkling wine aimed at the prosecco and pinot grigio customer to try something familiar but just a little different. It is a fresh, floral and aromatic wine balanced by citrus fruits, white peaches and minerality.
"If you love prosecco, you’ll love Progrigio," he added.
poll loading Will you be trying Asda's 'Progrigio'? 0+ VOTES SO FAR YES NO
Ed Betts, Asda wine buying manager comments: "We always strive to keep prices as low as possible without compromising on quality and we believe Progrigio is the ideal affordable sparkling wine alternative.”
"We want to protect the demand for sparkling wine by offering customers more choice, and by moving slightly away from the prosecco region we have discovered a great example of quality fizz at an everyday price."
